meanings.definition: To park again in a different spot.
meanings.sent1: After running errands, I reparked my car closer to the store entrance.
meanings.sent2: I had to repark my car because the original spot was too far from the event venue.
meanings.sent3: I reparked my car next to a giant inflatable dinosaur, making it the coolest car in the lot.
meanings.sent4: She reparked her car like a puzzle piece fitting perfectly into a new space.
meanings.sent5: The act of reparking my car under the shade felt like a small victory on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To move a parked vehicle to a different location.
meanings.sent1: The delivery truck reparked to unload closer to the building.
meanings.sent2: I reparked my car to avoid a parking ticket in the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The car reparked itself mysteriously in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: She reparked the car swiftly, like a skilled driver in a race.
meanings.sent5: The bus driver reparked the vehicle with precision, impressing the passengers.
